abstractText: This quite recent manuscript (18th or 19th century) contains the Vṛṣṭicintāmaṇi, a "charm for rain in 34 numbered sections or stanzas" (Bendall 1883: 103), composed by Rāja Jayapratāpa Malla (1641-1674). In this stotra ("poem of praise"), the heroic śaiva king claims mastery of the Buddhist world by descending into the sancta sanctorum of the great Buddhist stūpa of Svayambhū and by besting the nāgas in order to bring rain to a drought-stricken country.
